channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: Indian students fall, Chinese rise: How Trump's crackdown shaped Harvard's new admissions
How a ‘bureaucratic mess’ led to a college student being deported from US to Honduras
What are Trump's alternatives if tariffs are struck down by the US Supreme Court?
How palak paneer led to Rs 1.66 cr settlement for Indian students in US
The making of Islamic Nato: Will this bring Turkish arms, Pak nukes, and Saudi money together?
Havana Syndrome is back in the spotlight: Is it linked to a secret Pentagon device?
India hosts 28th CSPOC: Strengthening parliamentary democracy, global cooperation in uncertain world
item.description: The Conference of Speakers and Presiding Officers of the Commonwealth has emerged as a unique institution that upholds parliamentary independence and is non-partisan, even as it derives much from the Westminster system and traditions, and underscores the neutrality and authority of speakers

item.title: How German Chancellor Merz’s India visit carries a strategic message
item.description: Germany’s ‘Zeitenwende’ (strategic turning point) is no longer confined to Europe; it now extends to Asia, with India at its core

item.title: Why world should ignore Trump’s mockery of global leaders
item.description: President Trump mocking foreign leaders publicly makes even neutral international public dislike his behaviour, and it has little tangible or intangible gain for the US, which he statedly aims to ‘make great again’

item.title: Trumpism and the way forward for India
item.description: The future trajectory of relations will depend heavily on how both nations manage their divergent economic and foreign policy priorities

item.title: Why Dhaka should revisit China’s sinister role in the 1971 war
item.description: The shadows of the past—specifically China’s initial resistance to Bengali sovereignty—offer a sobering lesson in 'realpolitik' that remains relevant even today

item.title: It’s not the ‘Don-Roe Doctrine’: Silly US interventionism validated Putin’s invasion and gave China a playbook
item.description: Donald Trump is not reviving the empire so much as exposing its limits. The very need to assert hemispheric dominance so explicitly suggests that such dominance is no longer taken for granted
